required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Rapastinel for Rapid Treatment of Depression and Suicidality in Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter, Efficacy and Safety Study of Rapastinel for Rapid Treatment of Symptoms of Depression and Suicidality in Adult Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

lead_sponsor.agency: Naurex, Inc, an affiliate of Allergan plc

clinical_study.source: Naurex, Inc, an affiliate of Allergan plc

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of 450 milligrams (mg) of Rapastinel, compared to placebo in adult patients with major depressive disorder (MDD) who are at imminent risk of suicide.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study stopped due to business reasons.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sheehan - Suicidality Tracking Scale (S-STS) Total Score
primary_outcome.description: The S-STS is a patient-report informed, clinician-rated scale used to rate the severity of suicidal impulses, thoughts, and behaviors. This is a 14 item scale ranging from 0=Not at all to 4= Extremely. The total score ranges from 0 to 56 with a higher score indicating higher suicidal tendency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sheehan - Suicidality Tracking Scale (S-STS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The S-STS is a patient-report informed, clinician-rated scale used to rate the severity of suicidal impulses, thoughts, and behaviors. This is a 14 item scale ranging from 0=Not at all to 4= Extremely. The total score ranges from 0 to 56 with a higher score indicating higher suicidal tendency.

intervention.description: Rapastinel pre-filled syringes for weekly IV injections.
Placebo-matching rapastinel pre-filled syringes for weekly IV injections.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders - Fifth Edition (DSM-5) criteria for MDD
- Current major Depressive episode of at least 4 weeks and not exceeding 24 months in duration at visit 1
- Have current, ongoing suicidality (ideation or behavior) of sufficient severity to warrant hospitalization based on the judgment of the investigator
- If female of childbearing potential, have a negative serum β-human chorionic gonadotropin (β-hCG) pregnancy test.
Exclusion Criteria:
- DSM-5-based diagnosis of any disorder other than MDD that was the primary focus of treatment within 1 month before Visit 1.
- Lifetime history or currently meet DSM-5 criteria for:
1. Schizophrenia spectrum or other psychotic disorder
2. Bipolar or related disorder
3. Major neurocognitive disorder
4. Neurodevelopmental disorder of greater than mild severity or of a severity that impacts the participant's ability to consent, follow study directions, or otherwise safely participate in the study.
5. Dissociative disorder
6. Posttraumatic stress disorder
7. MDD with psychotic features
- Significant homicidal ideation or at imminent risk of injuring others or causing significant damage to property, as judged by the investigator.
- Prior participation in any investigational study of rapastinel/GLYX-13

facility.name: The Board of Trustees of the University of Alabama for the University of Alabama at Birmingham
Alexian Brothers Center for Psychiatric Research
Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Carilion Medical Center, a Virginia Nonprofit Corporation
Department of Veterans Affairs Salem VA Medical Center

link.description: Additional information on study locations near you may be found at AllerganClinicalTrials.com, please contact IR-CTRegistration@Allergan.com for assistance.

baseline.population: The modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population will consist of all patients in the Safety Population who had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of the MADRS total score or S-STS total score.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) total score at baseline
measure.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression.

measure.title: Sheehan - Suicidality Tracking Scale (S-STS) Total Score (Patient-rated)
measure.description: The S-STS is a patient-report informed, clinician-rated scale used to rate the severity of suicidal impulses, thoughts, and behaviors. This is a 14 item scale ranging from 0=Not at all to 4= Extremely. The total score ranges from 0 to 56 with a higher score indicating higher suicidal tendency.

measure.title: S-STS Total Score (Clinician-rated)
measure.description: The S-STS is a patient-report informed, clinician-rated scale used to rate the severity of suicidal impulses, thoughts, and behaviors. This is a 14 item scale ranging from 0=Not at all to 4= Extremely. The total score ranges from 0 to 56 with a higher score indicating higher suicidal tendency.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score
outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale to assess depressive symptomatology during the preceding week. Participants are rated on 10 items (feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and a lack of interest) each on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score ranges from 0 to 60 with a higher score indicating more depression. A negative change score indicates improvement.
outcome.population: The modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Population consists of all participants in the Safety Population who had at least 1 postbaseline assessment of the MADRS total score or S-STS total score.

reported_events.time_frame: The study consisted of a 4 week double-blind treatment period, followed by a 1-week safety follow-up period.
reported_events.desc: The Safety Population will consist of all patients in the Randomized Population who took at least 1 dose of randomized IP.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to study termination, the target number of participants needed to achieve target power and statistically reliable results was not met.
